en: You are always hearing but not listening.
You are quite a man.
Once you begin, you must continue.
You can always ask a question in return.
What on earth are you talking about?
You will know the truth some day.
Some day you will have to reap the harvest of your own sowing.
ko: 언젠가는 네가 뿌린 대로 거두게 될 거야.

en: How long have you been living in Kobe, then?
How long have you been alienated from your family?
ko: 가족이랑 사이가 멀어진 지 얼마나 됐어?

en: You are naughty.
How much money do you want?
You have some books.
You've given me good advice.
You are a good boy.
You need not to have called me up so late at night.
ko: 이렇게 밤늦게 전화 안 해도 됐는데.

en: You must be tired after such a long trip.
You shouldn't talk back to your parents like that.
You shouldn't talk back like that.
You shouldn't have eaten so much ice cream.
You are right in a way.
Have you ever been to America?
You had better not work too hard.
ko: 너무 무리해서 일하지 않는 게 좋겠어.

en: You don't exert yourself much.
You are too much letter-bound.
You cannot buy that judge.
ko: 그 판사는 돈으로 매수할 수 없어.

en: Have you ever been to that village?
ko: 그 마을에 가 본 적 있어?

en: I wish you had told me the truth then.
Are you on the committee?
You should have taken a chance then.
Do you know how high the television tower is?
ko: 저 TV 송신탑이 얼마나 높은지 알아?

en: You must stick to your promise.
You're a philosopher, aren't you?
You had better not associate with those men.
ko: 저 사람들이랑은 안 어울리는 게 좋아.

en: You are supposed to come at 7 o'clock.
You have to leave home at six.
You are expected to come by 5:00.
You must be at the station by 5 o'clock.
You must be here till five.
You look the way your father did thirty years ago.
ko: 너 30년 전 네 아버지 모습이랑 똑같다.

en: You must keep quiet for a few days.
You'll be able to drive a car in a few days.
ko: 며칠 지나면 운전할 수 있게 될 거야.

en: You may as well have a day off, because you have been overworking those days.
ko: 요즘 너무 무리했으니까 하루 쉬는 게 좋겠다.

en: Can you do it in one day?
You should have refused his offer.
You need to have breakfast.
Did you leave the window open?
You should by all means read the book.
You should be ashamed of your folly.
Are you doing what you think is right?
ko: 네가 옳다고 생각하는 일을 하고 있는 거야?

en: You are the only man in the world that I can call my friend.
ko: 세상에서 친구라고 부를 수 있는 남자는 너뿐이야.

en: It is better for you to do it now.
ko: 지금 하는 게 더 나을 거야.

en: You made the mistake on purpose, didn't you?
You had better set some money apart for your wedding.
ko: 결혼 자금으로 돈 좀 따로 모아두는 게 좋겠어.

en: You only started this job an hour ago.
ko: 이 일 시작한 지 겨우 한 시간밖에 안 됐잖아.

en: Which party do you belong to?
You may as well tell me all about it.
You may choose either of the two books.
You have to report to the police at once.
All you have to do is wait on any customers that come to the shop.
ko: 가게에 오는 손님들 응대만 하면 돼.

en: You can't go naked in this hotel.
ko: 이 호텔에서 벌거벗고 다니면 안 돼.

en: You must always keep your hands clean.
You are always digging at me about my clothes.
ko: 넌 항상 내 옷차림 가지고 트집이더라.

en: When did you begin learning German?
Please go on with your story.
Your story doesn't corroborate what I've heard before.
ko: 네 얘기가 내가 전에 들은 거랑은 좀 다르네.

en: There may be some truth in your story.
ko: 네 말에 어느 정도 일리가 있을지도 몰라.

en: Your story reminded me of my younger days.
ko: 네 얘기 들으니까 옛날 생각 난다.

en: Assuming your story is true, what should I do?
ko: 네 말이 사실이라면, 내가 어떻게 해야 할까?

en: Judging from what you say, he must be a great scholar.
ko: 네 말 들어보니까 그 사람 대단한 학자인가 보네.

en: In the light of what you told us, I think we should revise our plan.
ko: 네 말을 듣고 보니 우리 계획을 좀 수정해야 할 것 같아.

en: I can hardly hear you.
Omit needless words!
Please give me your permanent address.
Your parents didn't come, did they?
Meg called you during your absence.
ko: 너 없을 때 멕한테 전화 왔었어.

en: Your situation is analogous to mine.
I understand your position perfectly.
If I were in your situation, I would do the same thing.
I don't mean to challenge your theory.
I think your theory does not hold water.
ko: 네 이론은 좀 앞뒤가 안 맞는 것 같아.

en: Is there anything you want that you don't have?
Your summary is not up to par.
ko: 네 요약이 좀 기대에 못 미치네.

en: He came out shooting, same as you said he would.
ko: 네 말대로 그 사람이 총을 쏘면서 나왔어.

en: Your prophecy has come true.
Your friendship is most precious to me.
ko: 너랑 친구인 게 나한테는 정말 소중해.

en: I admire you for your courage.
I admire your courage.
I admire your brave deed.
ko: 네 용기 있는 행동이 정말 멋져 보여.

en: I rest on your promise.
I'll keep your problems in mind.
ko: 네 고민 잊지 않고 생각하고 있을게.

en: I see no analogy between your problem and mine.
ko: 네 문제랑 내 문제는 전혀 다른 것 같아.

en: You have lovely eyes, don't you?
Your eyes are red with crying.
Where are your eyes?
Your eyes have a certain magnetism.
ko: 네 눈은 사람을 끄는 매력이 있어.

en: Your driver's license has expired.
I will sell the boat in accordance with your orders.
Are you sure you want to put your life in her hands?
ko: 정말 걔한테 네 목숨을 맡겨도 되겠어?

en: Write your name in capitals.
I know your name.
Didn't you hear your name called?
Your daughter is not a child anymore.
ko: 네 딸은 이제 더 이상 어린애가 아니야.

en: I admire your ignorance.
I have no interest in putting my money into your dreams.
ko: 네 꿈에 내 돈을 투자할 생각은 전혀 없어.

en: This business plan of yours seems almost too optimistic. All I can say is I hope it's more than just wishful thinking.
ko: 네 사업 계획은 너무 낙관적인 것 같아. 그냥 희망 사항으로 끝나지 않길 바랄 뿐이야.

en: Your dream will come true some day.
It won't be long before your dream comes true.
The day is sure to come when your dream will come true.
ko: 네 꿈이 이루어지는 날이 꼭 올 거야.

en: The day will surely come when your dream will come true.
ko: 네 꿈이 이루어지는 날이 반드시 올 거야.

en: The time will come when your dream will come true.
ko: 네 꿈이 이루어질 때가 올 거야.

en: You have a regular pulse.
Tell me about your program for the future.
Your comic books are on the shelf.
How pretty your sister is!
What has become of your sister?
When did your sister leave Tokyo for London?
ko: 네 여동생은 언제 도쿄에서 런던으로 떠났어?

en: What grade is your sister in?
What's your real purpose?
Your book is double the size of mine.
ko: 네 책이 내 거보다 두 배나 크네.

en: Your book is on the desk.
I will be your guarantor.
Better to get advice from your lawyer.
ko: 변호사한테 상담받아 보는 게 나을 거야.

en: I am sick of your complaint.
Your allotment is $20.
Your dress is unsuitable for the occasion.
ko: 네 옷은 이 자리에 좀 안 어울려.

en: Your room is out of order.
Your room is twice the size of mine.
ko: 네 방은 내 방보다 두 배나 넓어.

en: Your room must always be kept clean.
ko: 네 방은 항상 깨끗하게 치워둬야 해.

en: You have been beaten. Give in!
Your father's supporters are not limited to his friends.
ko: 너희 아버지를 지지하는 사람들이 친구들뿐만이 아니야.

en: Please give my regards to your father.
Your father went through all that trouble for your sake.
ko: 너희 아버지는 널 위해 그 모든 고생을 하신 거야.

en: I'm tired of your complaints.
Your wrongdoing is a disgrace to our school.
Your smile always makes me happy.
ko: 네 웃는 모습은 항상 날 행복하게 해.

en: Your estimation of him is a little high, to say the least.
ko: 솔직히 말해서 넌 걔를 너무 높게 평가하고 있어.

en: It's your move.
Your hair is too long.
Your hair really does look untidy.
Your remarks are off the point.
Your problem is similar to mine.
You should know better at your age.
At your age, I would think so, too.
ko: 네 나이 때는 나도 그렇게 생각했을 거야.

en: At your age, you ought to know better.
Tell me about your daily life.
At your age you ought to support yourself.
ko: 그 나이면 이제 네 앞가림은 해야지.

en: Your second button is coming off.
ko: 너 두 번째 단추 떨어지려고 해.

en: You may read whichever book you like.
ko: 네가 읽고 싶은 책 아무거나 읽어도 돼.

en: Without your consent, nothing can be done about it.
ko: 네 동의 없이는 아무것도 할 수 없어.

en: Your motive was admirable, but your action was not.
Check your answers with his.
Check your answer with his.
Compare your answers with the teacher's.
Compare your answer with Tom's.
Your answer is to the point.
Your answer isn't correct. Try again.
Your answer is right.
Your answer is anything but perfect.
Your answer is wrong.
Your answer is far from perfect.
Your answer is far from satisfactory.
If your answer is correct, it follows that mine is wrong.
ko: 당신 답이 맞다면 제 답은 틀린 게 되겠네요.

en: I think your answer is correct.
It doesn't matter whether your answer is right or wrong.
Your efforts will soon pay off.
I'm sure your efforts will result in success.
Your efforts will pay off one day.
Your efforts will bear fruit someday.
Your effort will be rewarded in the long run.
ko: 결국에는 노력한 만큼 보상받게 될 거예요.

en: Your efforts will be rewarded in the long run.
I hope your efforts will bear fruit.
ko: 노력한 만큼 좋은 결과가 있으면 좋겠어요.

en: Come and see me when it is convenient for you.
You can come and see me whenever it's convenient for you.
ko: 편할 때 언제든 보러 와도 돼요.

en: I forget your telephone number.
Had I known your telephone number, I would have called you.
May I use your phone?
Your suggestion came up at the meeting.
His proposal is out of the question.
ko: 그 사람 제안은 말도 안 돼요.

en: Your suggestion amounts to an order.
Your suggestion will be rejected by the teacher.
Your proposal is a bit extreme.
Your suggestion is of no practical use.
I can't agree to your proposal on the ground that it is not fair and reasonable.
ko: 공정하지도 합리적이지도 않아서 그 제안에는 찬성할 수 없어요.

en: I am in favor of your proposal.
I cannot agree to your proposal.
There is certain to be some opposition to your suggestion.
ko: 그쪽 제안에 분명 반대하는 사람이 있을 거예요.

en: I don't mean to object to your proposal.
Bring your brother with you.
Is there no alternative to what you propose?
ko: 제안하신 거 말고 다른 대안은 없나요?

en: Your brother said you'd gone to Paris.
You'll be paid according to the amount of work you do.
ko: 일한 만큼 돈을 받게 될 거예요.

en: How many schools are there in your city?
ko: 그쪽 도시에는 학교가 몇 개나 있나요?

en: Can I count on your loyalty?
I'll act on your advice.
If only I had taken your advice.
If it were not for your advice, I would be at a loss.
ko: 당신 조언이 없었더라면 정말 막막했을 거예요.

en: Without your advice, I would have been robbed of my bag.
If it had not been for your advice, I would have failed.
Your idea leaves nothing to be desired.
ko: 그 아이디어는 더할 나위 없이 완벽해요.

en: It's none of your business.
Mind your own business!
When is your birthday?
I will give you a bicycle for your birthday.
Your birthday is drawing near.
You shall have a bicycle for your birthday.
I'll find someone to fill in for you.
Aren't you being very rude?
There's no room for excuses when it comes to your negligence, is there?
ko: 네 태만에 대해서는 변명의 여지가 없지?

en: Your son has come of age.
Your son took part in the student movement, I hear.
Is this your son, Betty?
I cannot accept your gift.
I'm fed up with your constant complaining.
What's your major field?
Your explanation won't wash; it's too improbable to be true.
ko: 네 설명은 안 먹혀. 너무 말이 안 되거든.

en: Your explanation sounds plausible, but it just doesn't hold water.
ko: 네 설명이 그럴싸하긴 한데, 앞뒤가 안 맞아.

en: Go back to your seat.
You may have good reason to think that your youth is over.
ko: 네 청춘이 끝났다고 생각할 만한 충분한 이유가 있을 수도 있어.

en: I can hear you, but I can't see you.
Your voice carries well.
I don't for a moment doubt your honesty.
ko: 난 네 정직함을 한순간도 의심하지 않아.

en: Your policy is mistaken.
Your marks were well below average this term.
ko: 이번 학기 네 성적은 평균보다 한참 낮아.

en: I was glad to hear of your success.
I'm sure of your success.
Your success excites my envy.
Your success will largely depend upon how you will make good use of your opportunity.
ko: 네 성공은 네가 기회를 어떻게 잘 활용하느냐에 달려 있어.

en: Your success depends upon whether you work hard or not.
ko: 네 성공은 네가 얼마나 열심히 하느냐에 달려 있어.

en: Your success depends on whether you pass the STEP examination or not.
ko: 네 성공은 네가 STEP 시험에 합격하느냐에 달려 있어.

en: I am glad to hear of your success.
ko: 네 성공 소식을 듣게 돼서 기뻐.

en: Which of your parents do you take after in character?
You're wide of the mark.
Your guess is entirely off the mark.
Your philosophy of life varies from mine.
You have no one but yourself to blame.
Your loving friend.
With reference to your request, I will support.
I read your new book with real delight.
ko: 네 새 책 정말 재미있게 읽었어.

en: Your new dress becomes you very well.
Let me put down your new phone number in my notebook.
Your behavior is creating a lot of problems.
ko: 네 행동이 많은 문제를 일으키고 있어.

en: I am far from pleased with your behavior.
ko: 네 행동이 전혀 마음에 안 들어.

en: What was it that caused you to change your mind?
I didn't mean to hurt you.
ko: 네 마음을 아프게 하려던 건 아니었어.

en: As you make your bed, you must lie on it.
Your principles are not consistent with your actions.
I don't like your taste in color.
We will make an exception of your case.
The button on your coat is coming off.
I like the way you smile.
Let's have a serious talk about your future.
ko: 네 미래에 대해서 진지하게 얘기 좀 하자.

en: I hope you have a happy future ahead of you.
ko: 너의 앞날에 행복한 일만 가득하길 바라.

en: Your advice has helped me see the light regarding my future.
ko: 네 조언 덕분에 내 미래가 좀 보이는 것 같아.

en: Your advice is always helpful to me.
ko: 네 조언은 나한테 항상 큰 도움이 돼.

en: I expect your help.
I don't need your help.
But for your help, I should have failed.
ko: 네 도움이 없었더라면 난 실패했을 거야.

en: Without your help, we wouldn't be able to carry out our plan.
ko: 네 도움 없이는 우리 계획을 실행할 수 없을 거야.

en: He is equal to the task.
ko: 그는 그 일을 충분히 해낼 수 있어.

en: We'll start whenever you are ready.
We will exempt you from attending.
When will your assignment be completed?
The ice will give under your weight.
ko: 네 무게 때문에 얼음이 꺼질 거야.

en: Write your address here.
Your income is about twice as large as mine.
ko: 네 수입은 내 거보다 거의 두 배나 많아.

en: Your income is about twice as large as mine is.
ko: 네 수입은 내 수입의 한 두 배 정도 돼.

en: Your income is three times larger than mine.
ko: 네 수입은 내 거보다 세 배나 많아.

en: Your attendance at classes was irregular.
I'll miss your cooking.
This happened prior to receiving your letter.
ko: 이건 네 편지를 받기 전에 일어난 일이야.

en: I received your letter yesterday.
Your letter made me happy.
What position do you hold?
Are your hands clean?
Your argument is not any more convincing than that of my stubborn father.
ko: 네 주장은 고집 센 우리 아빠보다도 설득력이 없어.

en: Please lend me your car.
Pull your car out a bit, I can't back my car out.
ko: 차 좀 앞으로 빼줘, 내 차를 못 빼겠어.

en: Would you mind lending me your car?
Your car makes too much noise. You should have it looked at.
ko: 네 차 소리가 너무 시끄러워. 점검 좀 받아봐.

en: Give me a lift in your car.
Compared with yours, my car is small.
ko: 네 거에 비하면 내 차는 진짜 작지.

en: What have you done with your car?
It is important that you attach your photo to the application form.
May I take your picture?
I would like your picture.
ko: 네 사진 한 장 갖고 싶어.

en: Your question does not bear on the subject under discussion.
ko: 네 질문은 지금 하는 얘기랑 상관없어.

en: Your question is not relevant to the subject.
Your questions were too direct.
Your question is hard for me to answer.
You have Jim to thank for your failure.
ko: 네가 실패한 건 다 짐 탓이야.

en: Will you lend me your dictionary?
May I borrow your dictionary?
Look up the definition of 'guy' in your dictionary.
Look up the words in your dictionary.
Could you lend me your bicycle for a couple of days?
ko: 며칠만 자전거 좀 빌려줄 수 있어?

en: Your bicycle is similar to mine.
Your bike is better than mine.
Is your watch correct?
Your watch seems to be very valuable.
Your watch is similar to mine in shape and color.
ko: 네 시계 모양이랑 색깔이 내 거랑 비슷하다.

en: Your watch is more expensive than mine.
ko: 네 시계가 내 거보다 더 비싸네.

en: Your watch is ten minutes slow.
What time is it by your watch?
Where are your things?
It is not my part to meddle in your affairs.
ko: 내가 네 일에 참견할 건 아니지.

en: Your examination results are excellent.
Your point may be a little off target, but it certainly is close.
ko: 네 말이 핵심에서 좀 벗어났을 수도 있는데, 거의 맞긴 해.

en: Just follow your heart.
ko: 그냥 네 마음이 가는 대로 해.

en: The population of your city is about five times as large as that of my town.
ko: 너네 도시 인구가 우리 동네보다 다섯 배 정도 많아.

en: Your sister enjoys watching sumo wrestling on TV.
ko: 네 동생 TV로 스모 보는 거 좋아하더라.

en: Your sister's as beautiful as ever.
I am only too glad to help you with your work.
ko: 네 일 도와주는 거라면 언제든 기쁘게 할게.

en: I think your work is all right.
ko: 너 한 거 괜찮은 것 같아.

en: Your work is below average.
Your work didn't come up to our expectations.
ko: 네가 한 게 우리 기대에 못 미쳤어.

en: Your work comes short of the expected standard.
What do you do?
Your work has greatly improved.
How is your work coming along?
Don't take it amiss if I criticize your work.
ko: 내가 네 일 비판해도 너무 기분 나쁘게 듣지 마.

en: When your business gets rolling we'll talk about an increase.
ko: 네 사업이 궤도에 오르면 인상에 대해 얘기해 보자.

en: May we accompany you on your walk?
ko: 산책 가는데 우리도 같이 가도 돼?

en: I left your umbrella in the bus.
All the compositions were good except yours.
Compare your composition with the example.
ko: 네 작문을 예시랑 한번 비교해 봐.

en: Your English composition is above the average.
Your composition was good except for the spelling.
Your composition leaves nothing to be desired.
ko: 네 작문은 더할 나위 없이 완벽해.

en: Your composition is very good, and it has few mistakes.
ko: 네 작문 정말 잘 썼어, 틀린 것도 거의 없고.

en: Your composition is as good as ever.
Your composition is perfect except for a few mistakes.
ko: 몇 군데 틀린 거 빼면 네 작문 완벽해.

en: Your composition is free from all grammatical mistakes.
ko: 네 작문은 문법적으로 틀린 게 하나도 없어.

en: There are few mistakes in your composition.
ko: 네 작문에 틀린 게 거의 없어.

en: Your essay has some mistakes, but as a whole it is very good.
ko: 네 에세이에 실수가 좀 있긴 한데, 전체적으로는 아주 좋아.

en: Your composition has a few mistakes.
ko: 네 작문에 틀린 게 몇 개 있어.

en: When talking about your last results, it is dependent on the last examination.
ko: 네 지난 결과에 대해 말하자면, 그건 지난 시험에 달려 있어.

en: Explain to him the difficult situation you are in.
ko: 네가 처한 어려운 상황을 그 사람한테 설명해 봐.

en: The trouble with you is that you talk too much.
ko: 네 문제는 말이 너무 많다는 거야.

en: What you have said doesn't apply to you.
ko: 네가 한 말은 너한테는 해당 안 돼.

en: Do you eat rice in your country?
You should come early in order for him to read your manuscript before your speech.
ko: 네 연설 전에 그분이 원고를 읽어보실 수 있게 일찍 오는 게 좋아.

en: Your conduct is perfectly legal.
ko: 네 행동은 법적으로 전혀 문제 없어.

en: Your conduct doesn't become a gentleman.
Your behavior is in conflict with your principles.
Your behavior is quite out of place.
ko: 네 행동은 상황에 전혀 안 맞아.

en: Your behavior is too extraordinary.
Your behavior admits of no excuse.
Your behavior leaves much to be desired.
You are not consistent in your actions.
Your action has offended his dignity.
Your conduct is beyond bearing.
ko: 너 하는 짓 진짜 못 봐주겠다.

en: What you did brought disgrace on the whole class.
ko: 너 때문에 우리 반 전체가 망신당했어.

en: I am ashamed of your conduct.
I cannot support your conduct.
ko: 난 네 행동 편 못 들어줘.

en: I can't decide unless you tell me your plan.
ko: 네 계획을 말해줘야 내가 결정을 하지.

en: Show me a fact which supports your idea.
ko: 네 생각이 맞다는 증거를 좀 보여줘 봐.

en: Please sum up your idea.
Express your idea clearly.
We have decided to adopt your idea.
Your ideas are different from mine.
ko: 네 생각은 내 생각이랑 좀 달라.

en: Your way of thinking is quite distinct from mine.
ko: 너랑 나랑은 사고방식 자체가 완전 달라.

en: Your guess is almost right.
We all consider that your idea is impractical.
ko: 우리 다 네 생각이 비현실적이라고 생각해.

en: Your idea is absolutely impossible.
ko: 네 생각은 절대 말도 안 돼.

en: Your ideas are ahead of the times.
ko: 네 생각은 시대를 앞서가는 것 같아.

en: Your idea seems to be similar to mine.
ko: 네 생각이 내 거랑 비슷한 것 같네.

en: Your view is too optimistic.
ko: 넌 너무 낙관적으로 보는 것 같아.

en: Your ideas are quite old fashioned.
Your thoughts are of no significance at all.
Your idea differs entirely from mine.
ko: 네 생각은 내 거랑 아예 딴판이야.

en: I liked your idea and adopted it.
ko: 네 생각이 마음에 들어서 그대로 하기로 했어.

en: I envy you your luck.
You may invite any person you like.
ko: 네가 부르고 싶은 사람 아무나 불러도 돼.

en: Choose your favorite racket.
Do as you like.
You may act however you wish.
Make your choice.
You have the freedom to travel wherever you like.
ko: 가고 싶은 데는 어디든 자유롭게 가도 돼.

en: I am amazed at your audacity.
You should make the best of your limited time.
ko: 짧은 시간이라도 최대한 잘 활용해야 해.

en: Your words are as good as violence.
Your remark amounts almost to insult.
Judging from what you say, he may succeed.
ko: 네 말 들어보니 걔 성공할 수도 있겠다.

en: I know what you mean.
What you are saying does not make sense.
ko: 네가 하는 말은 앞뒤가 안 맞아.

en: What you are saying is equal to "no", isn't it?
ko: 네 말은 안 된다는 뜻이지, 그치?

en: What you are saying is nothing but building a castle in the air.
I don't quite follow you.
ko: 네 말이 잘 이해가 안 가.

en: You're just being diplomatic.
ko: 넌 그냥 예의상 그렇게 말하는 거잖아.

en: You are not consistent.
It appears to me that you are right.
ko: 내가 보기엔 네 말이 맞는 것 같아.

en: She cannot have understood what you said.
ko: 걔가 네 말을 이해했을 리가 없어.

en: I accept what you say to some extent.
What you said does not apply to this case.
ko: 네가 한 말은 이번 경우엔 해당 안 돼.

en: What you said is also true of this case.
ko: 네 말이 이번 경우에도 딱 들어맞아.

en: What you say is neither here nor there.
Admitting what you say, I cannot agree with you.
ko: 네 말은 알겠는데, 찬성할 수는 없어.

en: I think you're right.
Admitting what you say, I still think you are wrong.
ko: 네 말이 무슨 뜻인지는 알겠는데, 그래도 네가 틀린 것 같아.

en: Admitting what you say, I still think that you were wrong.
ko: 니 말은 알겠는데, 그래도 네가 틀렸던 것 같아.

en: I admit that what you say is true, but I don't like the way you say it.
ko: 니 말이 맞긴 한데, 말하는 방식이 맘에 안 들어.

en: Though I admit what you say, I still think you are wrong.
ko: 니 말 인정은 하는데, 그래도 네가 틀린 것 같아.

en: Admitting what you say, I still think I am right.
ko: 니 말도 알겠는데, 그래도 내가 맞는 것 같아.

en: While I accept what you say, I still think I'm right.
ko: 니 말 받아들이긴 하겠는데, 그래도 내가 맞아.

en: Admitting what you say, I still think you are mistaken.
ko: 니 말은 알겠는데, 네가 착각하고 있는 것 같아.

en: Admitting what you say, I still think you are in the wrong.
ko: 니 말은 알겠는데, 그래도 네가 잘못한 거야.

en: I can not make out at all what you say.
ko: 네가 무슨 말을 하는 건지 도무지 모르겠어.

en: You may be right.
What you say is right.
I find it difficult to believe.
Your words must correspond with your actions.
Aren't you pushing it too far?
While I see what you say, I can't accept your offer.
ko: 무슨 말인지 알겠는데, 네 제안은 못 받아들이겠어.

en: What you say is quite wide of the mark.
ko: 니 말은 완전 헛다리 짚은 거야.

en: You are off the point.
All that you say is perfectly correct.
ko: 니 말이 하나도 안 틀리고 다 맞아.

en: What you say is usually true.
What you say is quite different from what I heard from him.
ko: 니 말은 내가 걔한테 들은 거랑은 완전 딴판인데.

en: I can't see what you mean.
You should pay more attention to what you say.
There is much truth in what you say.
I can make nothing of what you do or say.
ko: 네가 하는 말이나 행동이 도저히 이해가 안 돼.

en: If what you say is true, it follows that he has an alibi.
ko: 니 말이 진짜라면 걔한테 알리바이가 있다는 소리네.

en: I don't follow.
Your study will bear fruit.
Your dog may be really depressed.
What's become of your dog?
I have been anxious about your health.
I envy your good health.
Your conclusion is highly arguable.
Your decision is open to some debate.
ko: 네 결정은 좀 더 논의가 필요해 보여.

en: You can go or stay, as you wish.
I'm sorry to upset your plans.
I will go along with your plan.
Your plan is of no earthly use.
Your scheme is like a house built on the sand.
Your plan is bound to fail.
I'm afraid your plan will not work.
ko: 네 계획은 잘 안 될 것 같아 걱정이야.

en: Tell me the object of your plan.
Your plan seems better than mine.
ko: 네 계획이 내 것보다 나은 것 같아.

en: I approve of your plan.
Tell me about your plan.
Admittedly your plan makes sense, but I still think it will be very hard to carry out.
ko: 네 계획이 일리는 있는데, 실행에 옮기기는 진짜 힘들 것 같아.

en: There is a big hole in your stocking.
Your shoes do not go with the suit.
ko: 네 신발이랑 그 정장은 안 어울려.

en: Your shoes are here. Where are mine?
ko: 네 신발 여기 있어. 내 건 어디 있지?

en: Your shoes are here.
I'm sick of listening to your complaints.
ko: 네 불평 듣는 거 이제 지긋지긋해.

en: I cannot help laughing at your folly.
ko: 네 바보 같은 짓을 보니까 웃음밖에 안 나와.

en: You can read any book that interests you.
ko: 관심 있는 책은 뭐든 다 읽어도 돼.

en: It is not wise to put your money on a horse.
ko: 경마에 돈을 거는 건 현명한 일이 아니야.

en: Had it not been for your cooperation, I could not have finished the work in time.
ko: 네 협조가 없었다면 일을 제시간에 끝내지 못했을 거야.

en: Do you know what you're asking?
ko: 네가 지금 뭘 요구하는 건지 알아?

en: I forbid you to smoke.
His argument is more radical than yours.
ko: 걔 주장이 네 것보다 더 급진적이야.

en: Your poor memory is due to poor listening habits.
ko: 네 기억력이 안 좋은 건 잘 안 듣는 습관 때문이야.

en: The sooner you return, the happier your father will be.
ko: 네가 빨리 돌아올수록 아버지가 더 기뻐하실 거야.

en: Leave your desk as it is.
I think your basic theory is wrong.
ko: 내 생각엔 네 기초 이론이 틀린 것 같아.

en: Your wish will come true in the near future.
What's your wish?
Your eyes remind me of stars.
That is no business of yours.
Where is your school?
How many pupils are there in your school?
ko: 너희 학교 학생이 몇 명이나 돼?

en: Your singing puts professional singers to shame.
ko: 네 노래 실력은 프로 가수들도 울고 가겠다.

en: Your house needs repairing.
Your house is three times as large as mine.
ko: 너희 집이 우리 집보다 세 배는 더 커.

en: What direction does your house face?
ko: 너희 집은 어느 방향 보고 있어?

en: Make a sketch of your house.
I wish I could live near your house.
ko: 나도 너희 집 근처에 살고 싶다.

en: How many rooms are there in your house?
Let's meet halfway between your house and mine.
ko: 너희 집이랑 우리 집 중간에서 만나자.

en: How far is it from your house to the park?
Let's discuss your love problems on the way back from school.
ko: 학교에서 돌아오는 길에 네 연애 고민 얘기 좀 하자.

en: The time has come for you to play your trump card.
ko: 이제 네가 비장의 카드를 꺼낼 때가 됐어.

en: It is surprising that your wife should object.
Can I use your pencil?
Your pencils need sharpening.
You burnt a hole in my coat with your cigarette.
ko: 네 담배 때문에 내 코트에 구멍 났어.

en: Your speech will be recorded in history.
I count on your help.
If it had not been for your aid, I would not have succeeded in my business.
ko: 네 도움이 없었다면 사업에 성공하지 못했을 거야.

en: Without your assistance I would have failed.
ko: 네 도움이 없었다면 난 실패했을 거야.

en: If it had not been for your support, he would have failed in business.
ko: 네 지지가 없었다면 걔는 사업에 실패했을 거야.

en: Your English composition leaves nothing to be desired.
ko: 네 영어 작문은 더할 나위 없이 완벽해.

en: Your English leaves nothing to be desired.
ko: 네 영어는 더할 나위 없이 완벽해.

en: Your English is improving.
Your English is perfect.
I think your English has improved a lot.
ko: 내 생각엔 너 영어 실력이 진짜 많이 늘었어.

en: Your English has improved a lot.
Your English has made gradual progress.
ko: 네 영어 실력이 차츰차츰 나아지고 있네.

en: You are now quite at home in English.
Your method of teaching English is absurd.
ko: 네 영어 교육 방식은 말도 안 돼.

en: I'm amazed at your fluency in English.
ko: 네 유창한 영어 실력에 정말 놀랐어.

en: Every little thing you say gets on my nerves.
ko: 네가 하는 말 하나하나가 다 거슬려.

en: I want your opinion.
Don't press your opinions on me.
Your opinion is similar to mine.
Your opinion is far different from mine.
ko: 네 생각은 내 거랑 너무 달라.

en: Your opinion is very constructive.
I agree with some of your opinions.
Are your opinions representative of those of the other students?
ko: 네 의견이 다른 학생들을 대표하는 거야?

en: Your opinion is off the mark. That's plain to anyone.
ko: 네 생각은 좀 빗나갔어. 누가 봐도 그래.

en: Granting that favor is out of the question.
ko: 그 부탁을 들어주는 건 절대 안 돼.

en: Do you think that you can put your idea into practice?
ko: 네 아이디어를 실제로 옮길 수 있을 것 같아?

en: Your idea sounds like a good one.
It all depends how you handle it.
I'm annoyed at your selfishness.
ko: 너 이기적인 거 진짜 짜증 나.

en: Do the first example in your workbook.
ko: 문제집에 있는 첫 번째 예제 풀어봐.

en: I'll study your report.
Your report is pretty good, if not excellent.
ko: 최고는 아니더라도 네 보고서 꽤 괜찮아.

en: There are several spelling errors in your essay.
ko: 네 에세이에 맞춤법 틀린 게 몇 군데 있어.

en: I was disappointed with your paper.
If it had not been for your raincoat, I would have been drenched to the skin.
ko: 네 우비 아니었으면 나 홀딱 젖었을 거야.

en: Had it not been for your raincoat, I would have been drenched to the skin.
ko: 네 우비가 없었더라면 흠뻑 젖었을 거야.

en: Will you give me your radio for my bicycle?
Your selfishness will lose you your friends.
ko: 그렇게 이기적으로 굴면 친구 다 잃어.

en: Your sense of humor is beginning to exert itself.
ko: 너 이제 유머 감각이 좀 나오네.

en: I entirely approve of what you say.
I am losing my patience with you.
ko: 나 이제 너한테 참는 것도 한계야.

en: I don't know what to make of your actions.
ko: 네 행동을 어떻게 받아들여야 할지 모르겠어.

en: Your method is different from mine.
You're on the right track.
What you did is against the rules.
Your time is up.
It was very hard for me to find your flat.
ko: 네 집 찾는 거 되게 힘들었어.

en: Look about you.
I blush for your mistake.
ko: 네 실수 때문에 내가 다 부끄러워.

en: I'll give you anything that you want.
What's new with you? How is your new job working out?
ko: 별일 없지? 새로 들어간 직장은 어때?

en: You have the advantage of me.
Can I use your pen?
Your pen is better than mine.
As you make your bed, so you must lie in it.
ko: 자업자득이지 뭐. 네가 한 일은 네가 책임져야 해.

en: Your plan sounds great.
Your pitching is far superior to mine.
If I find your passport, I'll call you at once.
Your tie blends well with your suit.
Your tie has come undone.
Your dress is very nice.
I'll give you a call before I visit you.
I'll come to your place.
Your team doesn't have a prayer to win the championship game.
ko: 너희 팀은 결승에서 이길 가망이 전혀 없어.

en: I'm glad that your team won the game.
I have good news in store for you.
I'll make a model plane for you.
I'm not going out on a limb for you because you never helped me before.
ko: 너 나 예전에 안 도와줬잖아. 그러니까 나도 널 위해 위험을 무릅쓰고 싶지 않아.

en: Choose such friends as will benefit you.
I will do all I can for you.
ko: 내가 할 수 있는 건 다 해줄게.

en: You should keep company with such men as can benefit you.
Don't be angry with me, for I did it for your sake.
ko: 나한테 화내지 마, 다 너 잘되라고 한 일이니까.

en: I am ready to do anything for you.
ko: 널 위해서라면 뭐든 할 준비가 돼 있어.

en: I will do anything for you.
I'd do any damn thing for you.
ko: 널 위해서라면 못 할 게 없어.

en: I'd jump through hoops for you.
ko: 널 위해서라면 무슨 고생이라도 할 수 있어.

en: Your excellent work puts me to shame.
ko: 네가 일을 너무 잘해서 내가 다 부끄럽네.

en: What's the weight of your suitcase?
Your joke bears repeating.
You went too far in your joke.
Your shirt is torn. You better put on another shirt.
ko: 너 셔츠 찢어졌어. 다른 걸로 갈아입는 게 좋겠다.

en: Your shirt button is coming off.
I respect you for what you have done.
This advice of yours will go a long way toward solving the problem.
ko: 네 조언이 문제 해결에 정말 큰 도움이 될 거야.

en: We are worried about you.
I have absolute trust in you.
Your words make me fear for my life.
ko: 네 말 들으니까 생명의 위협이 느껴지네.

en: What are you fond of?
Is this your glass or your sister's?
ko: 이거 네 컵이야, 아니면 네 여동생 거야?

en: Your cake is delicious.
How many are there in your class?
Your collar has a stain on it.
Your camera is not as excellent as my camera.
ko: 네 카메라는 내 거만큼 좋진 않네.

en: Your camera is only half the size of mine.
ko: 네 카메라는 내 거 절반 크기밖에 안 되네.

en: Here is your bag.
I took your umbrella by mistake.
You'll get into trouble if your girlfriend finds out the truth.
ko: 여자친구가 사실을 알면 너 큰일 날걸.

en: Your mother is in critical condition.
Your mother must have been beautiful when she was young.
ko: 너희 어머니 젊었을 때 진짜 미인이셨겠다.

en: We came on account of your sick mother.
I think your father hoped you would go to college.
ko: 너희 아버지는 네가 대학에 가길 바라셨던 것 같아.

en: I'd like to see your father.
Your sister looks as noble as if she were a princess.
ko: 네 여동생은 공주처럼 정말 우아해 보여.

en: Is your uncle still abroad?
What does your aunt do?
Where does your uncle live?
Thanks to your help, I could succeed.
ko: 네 도움 덕분에 성공할 수 있었어.

en: Thanks to you, the job went well.
Thanks to you, I spent all my money.
Your essay is admirable in regard to style.
I have no idea what you mean.
ko: 네가 무슨 말을 하는지 전혀 모르겠어.

en: I'm tired of your everlasting grumbles.
ko: 너 맨날 투덜거리는 거 이제 지겨워.

en: Your chair is identical to mine.
I believe you.
While I understand what you say, I can't agree with you.
ko: 네 말은 알겠는데, 동의는 못 하겠어.

en: I don't agree with you.
ko: 난 네 의견에 동의 안 해.

en: Is your apartment well maintained?
Your idea cannot be brand new. I heard about it from another source last year.
ko: 네 아이디어 별로 새로운 거 아니야. 작년에 다른 데서 들은 적 있거든.

en: Your idea is definitely worth thinking about.
ko: 네 아이디어는 확실히 고민해 볼 가치가 있어.

en: I will dry your T-shirt.
Your T-shirt will dry soon.
I regret that I told you.
I have something to tell you.
I was almost afraid to talk to you.
ko: 너한테 말 걸기 좀 무서울 정도였어.

en: I have some good news for you.
I will find you a good doctor.
I want you to go to the post office.
ko: 네가 우체국 좀 갔다 왔으면 좋겠어.

en: You can count on the $3,000 I have promised you.
I'll make you a model plane.
I will forgive him out of consideration.
I will forgive him out of consideration for you.
ko: 네 체면을 봐서 그 사람 용서해 줄게.

en: There's a phone call for you from Akemi.
I want you to read this book.
Didn't I lend you some books? I'm sure I did.
ko: 내가 책 좀 빌려주지 않았어? 분명 그랬던 것 같은데.

en: You took the words right out of my mouth.
What you need is, in a word, patience.
All you need is to get a driver's license.
I will tell you a secret.
I have a message for you from her.
ko: 그녀가 너한테 전해 달라는 말이 있어.

en: You can't have understood what he said.
ko: 걔가 한 말을 네가 이해했을 리가 없어.

en: I feel for you.
I cannot help you, not but that I pity you.
ko: 도와줄 순 없지만, 네가 안쓰러운 건 사실이야.

en: I'll boil you the beans.
I refuse to be treated like a slave by you.
Your telegram arrived just as I was about to telephone you.
ko: 막 전화하려던 참에 네 전보가 왔어.

en: You are wanted on the phone.
I couldn't call you; the telephone was out of order.
ko: 전화기가 고장 나서 전화 못 했어.

en: I must offer you an apology for coming late.
I'll lend it to you.
I look around but it's you I can't replace.
ko: 둘러봐도 너를 대신할 수 있는 사람은 없어.

en: You shall have a nice present.
Do you know good from evil?
We'll give you your revenge.
Dozens of letters are awaiting you.
I'll make you a new suit.
ko: 양복 새로 한 벌 해 줄게.

en: Let me give you a bit of advice.
I will never forget seeing you.
ko: 너를 만났던 건 절대 잊지 않을 거야.

en: I ordered you to get out.
I was going to write to you, but I was too busy.
ko: 너한테 편지 쓰려고 했는데 너무 바빴어.

en: Who is that girl waving to you?
ko: 저기 너한테 손 흔드는 여자애 누구야?

en: I'll teach you how to drive a car.
I would like you to go instead of me.
I'll lend you my notebook.
I'm adamant that you should go.
ko: 네가 가야 한다는 내 생각은 확고해.

en: I can only say that I agree with you.
ko: 네 말에 동의한다는 말밖에는 할 말이 없네.

en: I want you to go.
I have been reflecting on what you said to me.
ko: 네가 나한테 한 말을 계속 생각해 봤어.

en: I wanted to show it to you.
I am counting on you to deliver the opening address.
ko: 네가 개회사를 해줄 거라고 믿고 있을게.

en: I waited outside on the chance of seeing you.
I'm very glad to see you.
I am looking forward to seeing you.
ko: 너 만나는 거 정말 기대하고 있어.

en: It's always delightful to see you.
To see you is always a great pleasure.
ko: 너를 보는 건 언제나 큰 기쁨이야.

en: I was chagrined at missing you.
How I've missed you!
I'll tell you how to swim.
I would like you to come with me.
There is a piece of good news for you.
You are in part responsible for it.
I want you to work harder.
I want to see you again.
I'm leaving it to you.
You have a bright future.
He couldn't be good for you.
ko: 그 사람은 너한테 좋은 사람이 아닐 거야.

en: You have no cause for anger.
You've got nothing to complain of.
You shall want for nothing.
I feel indebted to you for your help during my illness.
ko: 나 아플 때 도와줘서 정말 신세 졌어.

en: You have knowledge and experience as well.
What seems simple to you seems complex to me.
ko: 너한테 쉬운 게 나한테는 복잡해 보여.

en: I take my hat off to you.
I want you to be the next Soseki.
You have as much right as everyone else.
You have a tendency to talk too fast.
ko: 너 말을 너무 빨리 하는 경향이 있어.

en: Life lies in front of you.
Don't you have a sense of justice?
You have many caring friends.
You are very trying to me sometimes.
ko: 가끔 너 때문에 정말 힘들 때가 있어.

en: I expect you to be punctual.
You got me!
Can't you understand the pain of your parents?
There is nothing wrong with you.
You have a gift for music.
I can't lie to you.
I can't hide the fact from you.
You make me feel so guilty.
I've given up on you!
You have the advantage of a good education.
I expect you to work harder.
There are few high-ranking positions left open for you.
ko: 너를 위한 높은 자리가 별로 안 남았어.

en: You are entitled to try once again.
ko: 너 한 번 더 해볼 자격 있어.

en: You are hopeless.
You have a good friend in me.
I bear no grudge against you.
I'm afraid this job is too much for you.
ko: 이 일은 너한테 좀 무리일 것 같아.

en: I expect you know all about it.
ko: 너도 다 알고 있을 거라고 생각해.

en: You have no business doing it.
You deserve the prize.
You have no right to say so.
I take my hat off to you!
I blush for you.
Green suits you.
I am disgusted with you.
I can't thank you enough.
You seem to be insensible of their good intentions.
ko: 너 걔네 호의를 전혀 모르는 것 같아.

en: You have no right to oppose our plan.
All you can do is to wait.
I can't keep up with you.
I'd like to talk with you in private.
I have a very sore arm where you hit me.
How can you say that?
ko: 어떻게 그런 말을 할 수 있어?

en: You should have seen it.
I'll stand behind you if you are going to do it.
I guess that you can't do it.
We want you to sing the song.
I hope you have brains enough to see the difference.
ko: 그 정도 차이는 구분할 줄 알겠지.

en: Didn't I tell you so?
When you put it so strongly, I can't say I don't agree.
I'm anxious to see you.
You shall have a reward.
I'll lend you this book.
I'll give you this pendant.
I'll give you this camera.
I'll give you this money.
Never did I dream of meeting you here.
ko: 여기서 널 만날 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐어.

en: It is quite a surprise to see you here.
I little dreamed of seeing you here.
ko: 여기서 널 볼 줄은 생각도 못 했어.

en: You play the guitar quite like a professional, don't you?
Let me give you some advice.
I'll treat you.
I have a nice present to give you.
Can you do that?
I never see you but I think of my brother.
ko: 너만 보면 우리 오빠 생각이 나.

en: I owe you ten dollars.
A thousand yen is owed to you.
You should not play a joke on me.
Do your work in your own way.
I thought you'd be the last person to do such a thing.
ko: 네가 그런 짓을 할 줄은 정말 몰랐어.

en: If I were you, I'd be able to succeed.
ko: 내가 너라면 성공할 수 있었을 텐데.

en: You can make it! Go for it. I'll stand by you.
ko: 넌 할 수 있어! 화이팅. 내가 네 옆에 있을게.

en: You deserve to succeed.
You could get into the Guinness Book of World Records as the heaviest drinker.
ko: 너 술 진짜 잘 마신다, 기네스북 올라가도 되겠어.

en: I can't think of life without you.
ko: 너 없는 삶은 생각도 하기 싫어.

en: It's not the time but the will that you lack.
ko: 부족한 건 시간이 아니라 네 의지야.

en: You and I are good friends.
You and I are the same age.
Is it right that you and I should fight?
Beside you, I'm only a beginner at this game.
ko: 너에 비하면 난 이 게임 완전 초보야.

en: What's your relation with him?
I am not to blame any more than you are.
He, just like you, is a good golfer.
ko: 그 사람도 너처럼 골프 잘 쳐.

en: I as well as you am to blame.
I am not excited any more than you are.
I as well as you was late for school yesterday.
I share your idea.
I bought the same shirt as yours.
He is no more a fool than you are.
If only I could speak English as fluently as you!
ko: 나도 너처럼 영어를 유창하게 잘했으면 좋겠다!

en: You and I are very good friends.
There is a fundamental difference between your opinion and mine.
Either you or I have to go there.
ko: 너나 나 둘 중 한 명은 거기 가야 돼.

en: It is hard to distinguish you from your brother.
ko: 너랑 네 형제랑 정말 구분하기 힘들어.

en: I feel relaxed with you.
I'll take my chances with you.
I'd like to go with you, but as it is I can't.
ko: 너랑 같이 가고 싶은데, 지금 상황이 안 되네.

en: I'd like to go to the seaside with you.
I wish I could go to the party with you.
ko: 나도 너랑 파티에 갈 수 있었으면 좋았을 텐데.

en: It is a great pleasure being with you.
I beg to differ, as I disagree with your analysis of the situation.
ko: 미안하지만, 상황 분석한 게 내 생각과는 좀 달라서 난 동의 못 하겠어.

en: It pains me to disagree with your opinion.
ko: 네 의견에 반대하려니 마음이 안 좋네.

en: Listen, um, I was wondering, what are you and Molly doing tonight?
ko: 저기, 있잖아, 너랑 몰리 오늘 밤에 뭐 해?

en: You and I are good friends, but we have little in common.
ko: 우리 친한 친구지만, 공통점은 거의 없네.

en: I'm leaving you tomorrow.
I often think about the place where I met you.
ko: 너를 처음 만난 곳을 자주 생각하곤 해.

en: I would like to go to the concert with you.
He'll be sure to smell a rat if I'm with you.
ko: 내가 너랑 있으면 걔가 분명히 눈치챌 거야.

en: I would prefer to speak to you in private.
You really are hopeless.
You two are the nucleus of the team.
I'll get something to drink for both of you.
ko: 너희 둘 마실 것 좀 가져올게.

en: I don't like both of you going to such a place.
ko: 너희 둘 다 그런 곳에 가는 거 별로야.

en: There is enough bread for all of you.
Divide the cake among you three.
You students are supposed to be diligent.
How old will you be next year?
You had better not start until they arrive.
ko: 걔들 도착하기 전까진 시작 안 하는 게 좋겠어.

en: You should pay attention to his story.
ko: 그 사람 말 좀 잘 들어봐.

en: You must not smoke till you grow up.
ko: 어른 될 때까지 담배 피우면 안 돼.

en: What are you learning from the teacher?
You are young boys.
You belong to the next generation.
You may swim now.
You are to hand in your assignments by Monday.
You didn't need to hurry.
You must conform to the rules.
All of you did good work.
What do you learn at school?
You should try to be more polite.
ko: 좀 더 예의 있게 행동하려고 노력해봐.

en: All of you are diligent.
You must start at once.
It is imperative for you to act at once.
You must study hard and learn many things.
ko: 공부 열심히 해서 많은 걸 배워야 해요.

en: All you have to do is to learn this sentence by heart.
Are you students at this school?
You have to share the cake equally.
You should know what to read.
Compare your translation with the one on the blackboard.
ko: 본인 번역이랑 칠판에 있는 걸 비교해 보세요.

en: Compare your sentence with the one on the blackboard.
ko: 본인 문장이랑 칠판에 있는 걸 비교해 보세요.

en: Who is your teacher?
What was the cause of your quarrel?
I don't approve your decision.
I wonder which of you will win.
There are merits and demerits to both your opinions so I'm not going to decide right away which to support.
ko: 두 분 의견 다 장단점이 있어서 어느 쪽을 지지할지 바로 정하지 않을게요.

en: Your team is stronger than ours.
Any of you can do it.
ko: 여러분 중 누구라도 할 수 있어요.

en: Which of you came here first?
Did any of you gentlemen wait on this man?
I think I might join you, but I haven't decided yet.
ko: 저도 같이 갈까 하는데 아직 결정은 안 했어요.

en: You've got no alibi for the day of the murder.
Just as you treat me, so I will treat you.
ko: 네가 나한테 하는 만큼 나도 너한테 할 거야.

en: If you're going to the beach, count me in.
When will you complete the preparations?
Boys, don't make any noise.
All you have to do is wait.
Not only you but I also was to blame.
Not only you but also he is ignorant of the truth.
ko: 너뿐만 아니라 그 사람도 사실을 몰라.

en: He as well as you likes baseball.
Not only are you wrong, but I am wrong too.
ko: 너만 틀린 게 아니라 나도 틀렸어.

en: We are both to blame.
You are not the only one responsible for it, I am too.
ko: 그쪽만 책임이 있는 게 아니라 저도 그래요.

en: Only you answered the question.
Only you can carry the bag.
ko: 그 가방 들 수 있는 건 너밖에 없어.

en: What a memory you have.
You're the only one who can do it.
ko: 이걸 할 수 있는 사람은 너밖에 없어.

en: I'm quite all right if you have no objection to it.
You are the man I've been looking for.
You're the best man for the job.
Don't you move from here.
I hadn't recognized the importance of this document until you told me about it.
ko: 말씀해주시기 전까진 이 서류가 중요한지 몰랐어요.

en: I was disappointed at your absence.
Well may you ask why!
I had been to the hospital before you came.
ko: 너 오기 전에 이미 병원 갔다 왔어.

en: I took it for granted that you would come.
I had no idea that you were coming.
It doesn't matter whether you come or not.
It does not matter to me whether you come or not.
ko: 당신이 오든 안 오든 저랑은 상관없어요.

en: It's a pity that you can't come.
What is it that you want?
I want you.
Either you or your friend is wrong.
ko: 너 아니면 네 친구가 틀린 거야.

en: I'm amazed by the ease with which you solve the problem.
ko: 네가 그 문제를 너무 쉽게 풀어서 정말 놀랐어.

en: I will have left when you return.
ko: 네가 돌아올 때쯤 난 이미 떠났을 거야.

en: He will have left here by the time you return.
ko: 네가 돌아올 때쯤이면 걔는 이미 여기서 떠났을 거야.

en: I will have left here before you return.
ko: 네가 돌아오기 전에 난 이미 여기서 떠났을 거야.

en: I take it from your silence that you are not satisfied with my answer.
ko: 아무 말 없는 거 보니까 내 대답이 만족스럽지 않은가 보네.

en: We thought we would write out the directions, in case you got lost.
ko: 네가 길을 잃어버릴까 봐 약도를 그려두려고 생각했어.

en: I want to know if you'll be free tomorrow.
ko: 내일 네가 시간 되는지 알고 싶어.

en: I am glad that you have returned safe.
What would you do if you were in my place?
I would like you to think about what you would have done in my place.
ko: 네가 내 상황이었다면 어떻게 했을지 한번 생각해 봐.

en: What would you do in my place?
That you don't believe me is a great pity.
ko: 네가 날 믿지 않는다는 게 참 안타깝네.

en: The information you gave me is of little use.
ko: 네가 준 정보는 별로 도움이 안 돼.

en: You or I will be chosen.
ko: 너나 나 중에 한 명이 뽑힐 거야.

en: Either you or I am wrong.
It is not necessary for you to take his advice if you don't want to.
ko: 하기 싫으면 굳이 걔 조언을 들을 필요는 없어.

en: If you're busy, I'll help you.
Didn't they teach you common sense as well as typing at the school where you studied?
ko: 학교에서 타자 말고 상식 같은 건 안 배웠어?

en: I noticed you entering my room.
ko: 네가 내 방에 들어오는 거 봤어.

en: Never did I dream that you would lose.
ko: 네가 질 거라고는 꿈에도 생각 못 했어.

en: I will lend you whatever book you need.
I need you.
You do not necessarily have to go there yourself.
ko: 네가 직접 거기까지 갈 필요는 없어.

en: You did well to keep the secret.
Whether you like her or not, you can't marry her.
ko: 네가 걔를 좋아하든 말든 걔랑 결혼할 수는 없어.

en: I don't know whether you like her or not.
It is not good that you did not ask her name.
ko: 걔 이름을 물어보지 않은 건 별로였어.

en: It is cruel of you to find fault with her.
ko: 걔 꼬투리를 잡다니 너 정말 너무하다.

en: What you said to her isn't accepted as a joke.
ko: 네가 걔한테 한 말은 농담으로 안 들려.

en: Either you or she has to go there.
ko: 너나 걔 중 한 명은 거기 가야 해.

en: As you have insulted him, he is cross with you.
ko: 네가 걔를 모욕했으니까 걔가 너한테 화난 거야.

en: We thought it wrong that you should punish him.
ko: 네가 걔를 벌주는 건 잘못됐다고 생각했어.

en: It is no use your waiting for him.
It is no use your trying to persuade him.
Does he know that you love him?
ko: 네가 걔 좋아하는 거 걔도 알아?

en: Imagine yourself to be in his place.
You did well not to follow his advice.
It was foolish of you to accept his offer.
ko: 걔 제안을 받아들이다니 넌 정말 바보 같았어.

en: You did wrong to refuse his help.
ko: 걔 도움을 거절한 건 네가 잘못한 거야.

en: Either you or he is wrong.
Either you or he has to attend the meeting.
ko: 너나 걔 중에 한 명은 회의에 참석해야 해.

en: It was wise of you to ask him for help.
You are quite justified in answering him back.
Whatever you said to him made him feel better.
ko: 네가 무슨 말을 했든 걔 기분이 좀 나아졌어.

en: I can't approve of your going out with him.
ko: 네가 걔랑 사귀는 거 허락 못 해.

en: I cannot approve of your going out with him.
ko: 난 네가 걔랑 나가는 거 찬성할 수 없어.

en: I don't approve of your going out with him.
ko: 난 네가 걔랑 만나는 거 반대야.

en: Either you are right or he is.
ko: 네가 맞거나 아니면 걔가 맞는 거겠지.

en: Show me what you bought.
How much is the car you are planning to buy?
I saw you with a tall boy.
ko: 키 큰 남자애랑 같이 있는 거 봤어.

en: He is no more foolish than you are.
It is amazing that you won the prize.
ko: 너 상 탄 거 진짜 대단하다.

en: It's a pity that you should leave Japan.
I'll take over your duties while you are away from Japan.
ko: 너 일본 가 있는 동안 내가 네 일 대신 해줄게.

en: I am going to do it whether you agree or not.
ko: 네가 찬성하든 말든 난 할 거야.

en: I don't object to your going out to work, but who will look after the children?
ko: 너 일 나가는 건 괜찮은데, 애들은 누가 봐?

en: I'm very happy you'll be visiting Tokyo next month.
ko: 다음 달에 네가 도쿄 온다니 진짜 좋다.

en: You have good reason to be angry.
The success resulted from your efforts.
We were just talking about you when you called.
ko: 너 전화했을 때 딱 네 얘기하고 있었어.

en: It is difficult for you to climb to the mountaintop.
ko: 네가 산꼭대기까지 올라가는 건 힘들 거야.

en: It's quite plain that you haven't been paying attention.
ko: 너 집중 안 한 거 다 티 나.

en: Your advice led me to success.
It is a pity that you can't join us.
You had better not wake me up when you come in.
ko: 들어올 때 나 깨우지 않는 게 좋을 거야.

en: I sincerely hope that you will soon recover from your illness.
Unless you make a decision quickly, the opportunity will be lost.
ko: 빨리 결정 안 하면 기회 놓칠 거야.

en: I hope that you will get well soon.
I found the very thing you had been looking for.
It is plain that you have done this before.
ko: 이거 해본 적 있는 거 다 보여.

en: I don't care whichever you choose.
It is not surprising that you should be scolded by your teacher.
ko: 선생님한테 혼난 거 하나도 안 놀라워.

en: You speak first; I will speak after.
ko: 네가 먼저 말해, 내가 그다음에 할게.

en: Well do I remember the day you were born.
ko: 네가 태어난 날 정말 생생하게 기억나.

en: I guess you are right.
If you are honest, I will hire you.
Do what you think is right.
Your success depends on your efforts.
Whether you will succeed or not depends on your efforts.
I'm so glad that you succeeded.
I am glad that you have succeeded.
I'm glad to hear of your success.
It's to your credit that you told the truth.
What happened to the girl you were sharing the bedroom with?
ko: 너랑 방 같이 쓰던 그 여자애 어떻게 됐어?

en: I should be glad if you got the job.
ko: 네가 그 일 구하게 되면 좋겠다.

en: You may or may not win.
ko: 이길 수도 있고 아닐 수도 있지.

en: I will do it on the condition that you help me.
If it were not for your help, I might have failed.
Thanks to your help, I could understand the book quite well.
ko: 네 도움 덕분에 그 책 잘 이해할 수 있었어.

en: Your o's look like a's.
They will have arrived there before you start.
ko: 네가 출발하기 전에 걔네 거기 도착해 있을 거야.

en: He came after you left.
You must do your homework at once.
Who took care of the dog while you were away?
ko: 너 없는 동안 강아지는 누가 돌봤어?

en: I will wait till you have written the letter.
ko: 너 편지 다 쓸 때까지 기다릴게.

en: It is strange that you should fail.
You may fail, for all I care.
The reason why you failed is you did not try hard enough.
ko: 네가 실패한 이유는 노력을 충분히 안 해서야.

en: When you speak of a pay-raise before recognition, I am inclined to think you are putting the cart before the horse.
ko: 인정도 받기 전에 월급 인상부터 얘기하는 건 앞뒤가 바뀐 것 같아.

en: A time will come when you will regret your action.
ko: 네 행동을 후회할 날이 꼭 올 거야.

en: You may as well go yourself.
ko: 그냥 네가 직접 가는 게 나을 거야.

en: You should talk to the teacher yourself.
You talk next and you be quiet.
ko: 다음은 네가 말하고, 너는 좀 조용히 해.

en: We heard the news that you had passed the exam.
I think it's a pity you could not come to our party.
ko: 우리 파티에 못 와서 정말 아쉬워.

en: I don't like you any more than you like me.
ko: 네가 나 싫어하는 만큼 나도 너 별로 안 좋아해.

en: I love you more than you love me.
ko: 네가 날 사랑하는 것보다 내가 널 더 사랑해.

en: Either you or I must go in his place.
ko: 너나 나 둘 중 하나는 그 사람 대신 가야 해.

en: What's the reason that made you call me?
What is it that you want me to do?
I can't thank you enough for what you did for me.
ko: 나한테 해준 일들, 정말 말로 다 못 할 정도로 고마워.

en: I hope you will join us in the parade and march along the street.
ko: 너도 우리랑 같이 퍼레이드에 참여해서 거리를 걸었으면 좋겠어.

en: I wish you could come with us.
ko: 너도 같이 갈 수 있으면 좋을 텐데.

en: I'll look after your affairs when you are dead.
ko: 네가 죽으면 내가 뒤처리 다 해줄게.

en: I don't have as much money as you think.
ko: 나 네 생각만큼 돈 많지 않아.

en: How much money did you spend in total?
Can you account for all the money you spent?
ko: 쓴 돈 어디에 썼는지 다 설명할 수 있어?

en: I will wait until you have finished your homework.
It makes no difference whether you agree or not.
With your approval, I would like to offer him the job.
ko: 네가 허락한다면 그 사람한테 일자리를 제안하고 싶어.

en: It was wise of you to take your umbrella with you.
ko: 우산 챙겨간 건 정말 잘한 일이야.

en: Show me the doll that you bought yesterday.
Nothing is so tasty as the dish you make.
ko: 네가 만든 요리만큼 맛있는 건 없어.

en: I'll help you so long as you do your best.
Choose the color you like the best.
The paint on the seat on which you are sitting is still wet.
ko: 너 지금 앉아 있는 의자, 페인트 아직 안 말랐어.

en: It makes little difference whether you go today or tomorrow.
ko: 오늘 가든 내일 가든 별 차이 없어.

en: It will not make much difference whether you go today or tomorrow.
ko: 오늘 가든 내일 가든 크게 상관없을 거야.

en: Your mother has made you what you are.
ko: 너를 지금의 너로 만든 건 네 어머니야.

en: What you've just told me chimes in with what I heard yesterday.
ko: 방금 네가 한 말이 어제 들은 거랑 딱 맞아떨어지네.

en: What you need the most now is courage.
ko: 너한테 지금 제일 필요한 건 용기야.

en: This is all you have to do now.
It is necessary for you to go and encourage the girl.
ko: 네가 가서 그 애를 격려해줘야 해.

en: It makes no difference whether you go or not.
You don't need to go unless you want to.
If you don't go, I won't, either.
ko: 너 안 가면 나도 안 가.

en: You don't have to go unless you want to.
ko: 가고 싶지 않으면 굳이 안 가도 돼.

en: I don't care as long as you are happy.
Your meaning is beyond me.
ko: 네가 무슨 말을 하는 건지 도저히 모르겠어.

en: What you have said applies only to single women.
ko: 네가 한 말은 미혼 여성들한테만 해당되는 거야.

en: What you said surprised me.
Whatever you may say, I won't give it up.
ko: 네가 뭐라고 하든 난 포기 안 할 거야.

en: The picture you are looking at is a copy of a Picasso.
ko: 네가 보고 있는 그 그림, 피카소 모작이야.

en: The picture you are looking at costs 100,000 yen.
ko: 네가 보고 있는 그 그림, 10만 엔이야.

en: What I can't make out is why you have changed your mind.
ko: 이해가 안 가는 건, 왜 네 마음이 바뀌었냐는 거야.

en: I'll make allowances for your lack of experience.
By the time you get out of jail, she'll probably have gotten married.
ko: 너 감옥에서 나올 때쯤이면 그 여자는 아마 결혼했을 거야.

en: Either you or your brother is wrong.
ko: 너 아니면 네 형이 틀린 거야.
